title: Kevin McCarra
text:
Kevin J. McCarra (1 February 1958 – 24 October 2020) was a <a href="Scottish%20people">Scottish</a> sportswriter.
Biography.
McCarra was educated at <a href="Glasgow%20University">Glasgow University</a>, receiving a <a href="Master%27s%20degree">MA (Hons) degree</a>. McCarra was married to Susan Stewart.
He was chief <a href="Association%20football">football</a> correspondent for "<a href="The%20Guardian">The Guardian</a>" newspaper. He often appeared on the Guardian Podcast <a href="Football%20Weekly">Football Weekly</a> hosted by <a href="James%20Richardson%20%28television%20presenter%29">James Richardson</a>. He also worked for "<a href="Scotland%20on%20Sunday">Scotland on Sunday</a>", "<a href="The%20Sunday%20Times">The Sunday Times</a>" and "<a href="The%20Times">The Times</a>", and appeared on <a href="BBC%20Radio%20Scotland">BBC Radio Scotland's</a> "Good Morning Scotland" as a newspaper reviewer.
He died from <a href="Alzheimer%27s%20disease">Alzheimer's disease</a> on 24 October 2020, aged 62.
